column3: Spines (0=absent; 1=spine of rank 2 present anywhere on mesosoma or petiole); All spinescence data based on Antweb images (accessed December 2014) unless otherwise noted in References
column4: Eyes (0=absent/0-1 ommatidia, 1=2-10 ommatidia, 2=11-100 ommatidia; 3=greater than 100 ommatidia); Data from Bolton (1994) unless otherwise noted in References
column5: Eyes (binary binned, 0 = 0 or 1, 1 = 2 or 3; in polymorphic cases, decision was made based on majority case)
column6: Polymorhism (0=monomorphic; 1=some size variation but not polymorphic; 2=polymorphic); Data from Bolton (2003) unless noted otherwise in References
column7: Polymorhism (same as original column, but with polyphenisms converted to corresponding polymorphic number, e.g. 0&2 -> 2)
column13: Max colony size binned (0 = <100, 1 = >100 to 999, 2 = 1000+; flat 100 or 1000 is considered 0 or 1, respectively; a range with a max terminating at 100 or 1000 is considered 0 or 1, respectively)

column12: "Typically containing fewer than 100 workers… though colonies of A. faurei were found to have about 400 workers" (Schmidt and Shattuck 2014)
"usually several thousand" but as high as in the 10,000's
"typically fewer than 200", but up to 1,800+, and even 10-100 thousand
